intro: Prenanthes macilenta, commonly known as the slender water hemp, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and stream banks. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, a common feature among its family. Prenanthes macilenta is often found in disturbed habitats and can be an indicator of wetland ecosystems.
